titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress concerning United States and allied Armed Forces personnel killed or wounded or taken captive while engaged in the war on terrorism and the war with Iraq and offering deepest sympathy to the families of those killed in action.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on International Relations, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Total Force.

bill.summary: 3/26/2003--Introduced. Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) those U.S. and allied Armed Forces that were killed, wounded, or missing in action or those who were taken captive in the war with Iraq are to be recognized for their ultimate sacrifice and commended for their courage; (2) the families of U.S. and allied service members currently deployed are deserving of the unequivocal support and appreciation of the Nation; and (3) all U.S. citizens should extend their deepest sympathy to the families of the members of the U.S. and allied forces killed in action.
